|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM6AA160TS-5G; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== AKA the router that Verizon sold for like ten bucks shipped next-day free. :See [https://sites.google.com/a/tds.net/unlock-your-verizon-westell-7501-wireless-g-router/ Lemonade] <small> *The default SSID is the serial number. A sample serial number is ''08FX08012314'' :(''08FXxxxxxx'' is one likely pattern, some devices may use other variants).
*The devices also broadcast a hidden SSID by default. Sample SSID is ''VZHR012314'' :(it simply appears to be ''VZHR'' followed by the last 6 digits of the serial number). :Pressing the WPS button on the top of the unit will unmask the SSID temporarily. </small> The power adapter included with the device is a :''Westell'' MT12-4120100-A1 (12V/1A).
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=65443 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums] *[http://archive.slickdeals.net/f/1874458-Verizon-Wireless-802-11b-g-Wireless-Router-w-4-Switch-Ports-6-50? On '''SlickDeals''']
